reviews.title: Nice Waterfront
text: Nice waterfront park. It is a great place to enjoy the view of the lake while watching some local people. You may spot some local animals too.

reviews.title: Best to Avoid
text: This park is just a boardwalk along the Lake, at the mouth of the Humber River.   It just too many people and too crowd.  Best to avoid if you want a quiet walk.

reviews.title: Close to the city and nice beach. Coffee? Yes. But not so good
text: The smalll beach and park are a great spot to hang out with young kids. They can bike and there is a park nearby
When it comes to eat the Cafe there has a great voew and location however the food isn’t that great. Coffee was mediocre

reviews.title: Beautiful place
text: One of the best places to have a lovely calm time.Cycling tracks and walkways as well. places to have family picnics.

reviews.title: my favourite place in Toronto
text: beautiful and peaceful place just downtown Toronto, at the same time beach and park with benches and tables for picnics and such a good restaurant the pavillon
great place!

reviews.title: Quiet Sunday on the beach: too cold!
text: Yet, as others have said, the views are super. Lots of seabirds and some swans all over. I can just imagine lying in the sand or having a picnic.  Nice huge building by the beach with lots of potential; I guess all they need is money to redo it. Huge, and I say huge, swimming pool -- closed for the season. Maybe next year.

reviews.title: Where you wanted to be
text: We went there numerous times, Spring, Summer and Fall. The beaches is beautiful. The view was gorgeous. Just want to enjoy the weather, view the stunning skyline of Toronto, or simply take a walk, to relax, it is the place you wanted to be. Currently, before 5pm on weekday, the parking is free, otherwise just 3 quarters for half an hour. Easily accessible.

reviews.title: Loved Roper Blading on Path
text: Bladed from Park place to end of Sunneydale park.  Path is smooth.  Great park to relax.  Enjoy the view and nice grass and benches.

reviews.title: slept good
text: was a little more then I'm accustom to paying but I found this place very comfortable and extremely clean

reviews.title: Great Park to Relax
text: This is a nice and most of the time well maintained park.  Lots of room for activities on the grass or the beach.  There is large walkway for rollerbladers, joggers and a separate bike path cyclists.  I like that you can take the path all the way along Lakeshore so if you want to go for a long walk and enjoy the scenery you can.

reviews.title: Beautiful park on the Lakeshore
text: A hot spot to take the sun and enjoy the beach! Drinks and food are sold inside the famous Sunnyside Pavilion.

reviews.title: Nice place but very cold
text: It was very nice but the water is so cold your bones hurt ! But i nice beach !

reviews.title: Wild!!
text: The most recent of my numerous stays in Toronto was on August 23rd and 24th of this year, when I came down to see the Canadian National Exhibition. During this stay, I decided to investigate Sunnyside Park on Lake Shore Boulevard, which had been my mother's favorite playground as a child. Much to my pleasure, I found the park to be just as lovely and peaceful as Mom had always described it! The old Sunnyside Carnival is now, unfortunately, only a memory, but the park proper still featured just about everything you could ask for enjoying a sunny afternoon: plenty of shady picnic area, including several pavilions; numerous small playgrounds scattered throughout the park (I LOVED the concrete dinosaurs!); an Olympic-sized swimming pool and two children's wading pools with fountains; several in-park commercial eateries, including a barbecue shack and a pizza kiosk which also sold the most delicious custard cones; a boardwalk, jogging trails, an old-fashioned dance hall (not open at the time I was there), and much more! Best of all was Sunnyside Beach, adjacent to the park: a "wild" beach which I fell head over heels in love with, pebble-lined shoreline and all!! Beautiful water, almost glass-smooth with the shallowest of waves, due to a beach-length fishing pier several hundred yards from shore; nice velvety sand to walk on in the water once you get past the pebbles, at about a three-foot depth;  and best of all, an incredible assortment of wild waterfowl, including - I couldn't believe my eyes - a family of wild Trumpeter swans!!! Mom and Pop were unbelievably beautiful, whiter than snow, all grace and serenity once they waded into the water; their four chicks were half-grown, covered with shaggy grey feathers and totally adorable! Along with the swans were dozens of Canadian geese in various growth stages, from half-grown chicks to adults, all making a pleasant racket - and, of course, the ever-present seagulls, many of whom were diving offshore and actually seemed to be fishing - that was the first time I'd ever actually seen gulls fish! All in all, I LOVED Sunnyside Beach and Park - I can't wait to see it again next summer!! (P.S. - the Four Points by Sheraton Hotel on Lake Shore Boulevard is directly across the street from Sunnyside - tourists with children might want to keep that in mind when deciding on a hotel!)

reviews.title: One Great Park!
text: Looking for a place to relax? Sunnyside is the place to be.The beaches are well kept and the park area is clean. Lots of free parking and the restrooms are well maintained.

reviews.title: Loved every second!
text: How fortunate we were to find this wonderful park/beach on the edge of Lake Ontario during our visit to Toronto.

The beach is beautiful, very clean, and swimming is permitted in the lake. Several trees on the beach provide some shelter from the heat of the July sun, and there are also some logs on the beach to sit on to avoid the heat of the sand.
Surprisingly the beach was almost deserted until early afternoon when more people arrived, but the atmosphere was still very tranquil.
Wonderful. Please visit for yourself because it's well worth it.
I hope this was helpful.

reviews.title: Beautiful escape from the city
text: Amazing place to walk and take in the view during the summer.  The west side is quieter and more suited to families. Easily hit you 10k steps for you day and not even feel it.

reviews.title: West end alternative to the Beaches
text: Park located on a strip between Lake Shore Boulevard and Lake Ontario. Martin Goodman Trail passes through the park. Lifeguards are on duty in the beach during summer. The boardwalk is nice along shoreline. There are some fast food vendors in busy days. Parking is nightmare during weekends.

reviews.title: Great Views
text: Went there with my friends. Its a nice place for families and youngsters for sports like walking, jogging, bicycling & roller skating etc. Although the parking is paid, nevertheless, park & beach are free for everyone. The views are really great, specially at sunrise & sunset.

reviews.title: Wonderful Park by the lake and Free Swimming!
text: My son and I went for a swim first in the lake, then in the pool. Even though the Pavilion is being renovated at the moment - the pool was still wonderful, free and worth the visit. [lockers just 25cents] Its incredibly close to Queen Street West [the Roncesvalles side] and was minutes away from our hotel. There was several dozen Dragon Boats out from the Sunnyside Paddling Club as well... it was great to watch them in action. I will be back!

reviews.title: A perfect little spot on the water that is easy to find
text: You can easily park at the beach or you can take ttc.  It is quite easy to get to over the walking bridge at King/Queen/Roncesvalles.  Bring a picnic, Frisbee, swimsuit, blanket, water bottle, camera and sunscreen.  A perfect spot to walk on boardwalk or just sit and enjoy the waterfront.  Washrooms are cleaned regularly.  There are snack shops and a restaurant if you wish.  You can stay in the evening without any safety issues.

reviews.title: A perfect family destination.
text: Sunnyside Beach is one of Toronto's great treasures and it is completely free.
Bike and walking trails, a large park with open field as well as shaded picnic areas and a clean, roped-off swimming area.
Food, drinks and restrooms are all available in the pavillion.
A children's playground and wading pool is located a very short walk to the East along the boardwalk at nearby Budapest Park.

reviews.title: A wedding to remember
text: Attended one of my oldest friends weddings at the pavillion and it was beautiful -- was a great experience

reviews.title: Great Park on Centre Island
text: We were riding our Bixi bikes around this park all Saturday.  It has a lovely beach and plenty of placed to picnic.  A little crowded on weekends!
